cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west today, turning WNW tonight and NW Friday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast then north into Arkansas and Missouri
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near or just west of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast across Louisiana and Mississippi to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible (below tropical-storm strength, most likely under 34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is far inland on the Missouri River
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant tropical moisture could bring periods of heavy rain with local totals around 2-4 inches, creating runoff issues
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river/flash flooding on tributar­ies feeding the Missouri River which could disrupt barge schedules and river levels near the port
